metadata.title: CVE-2015-8869 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
OCaml before 4.03.0 does not properly handle sign extensions, which allowsremote attackers to conduct buffer overflow attacks or obtain sensitiveinformation as demonstrated by a long string to the String.copy function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ocaml - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-base - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-base-nox - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-interp - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-mode - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-nox - 4.02.3-9
ocaml-source - 4.02.3-9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ocaml package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.02.3-9').
